intro: Bryophyllum humificum, commonly known as the leafy liverwort, is a type of non-vascular plant belonging to the family Marchantiaceae. It is characterized by its simple, undifferentiated structure, lacking true roots, stems, and leaves. This plant thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found on rocks or soil surfaces in temperate regions. Bryophyllum humificum reproduces through spores, which are released from specialized structures called sporophytes. Its role in ecological systems includes contributing to soil stabilization and providing microhabitats for other organisms.
